title: Is this bannable?
body:
In the middle of a game, have to take a dump.
about to fight.
calls brother from the basement to play for me so i don't get reported.

gets a double kill.

is this really "sharing your account"? its out of emergency, and before anyone says "you should have predicted that",
i had no food within the past 6 hours or any liquids.

replies.body: As long as you, lets say: NOT TELL EVERYBODY THAT YOU SHARE YOUR ACCOUNT you should be fine.

> [{quoted}](name=deathgod5,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=u9TkMJto,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-05-05T13:49:29.554+0000)
>
> As long as you, lets say: NOT TELL EVERYBODY THAT YOU SHARE YOUR ACCOUNT you should be fine.

even if i do get banned, i become an example huh?

Yes, you become an example of people that broke the stated rules around account sharing and then told everybody on the riot boards about it.

Or, and this is probably more likely, you will probably just be ignored because they do not consider you to be the problem with account sharing.

They really established this rule to get around Elo boosters/people that claim their account was banned when they were toxic because their brother was playing. You shouldn't really be worried about it unless you get detected by the reporting system in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=SkiTheSmurf,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=u9TkMJto,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-05T06:11:11.564+0000)
>
> Is this a troll post?

no.

check my OP.GG ms.fortune game against sona.
Riot has nothing better to do so maybe youâ€™ll get banned

To be fair, shit happens.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

If you don't explicitly say "I'm back! My brother was playing for me while I took a dump, what happened while I was gone?" - how would anybody know? You were never logged off during the switch, and were most likely running on the same machine you're usually on.

By the sound of it, it seems that you're not sharing your account information, and you're not asking for help for the purpose of boosting. Sharing account information with anyone, including family members, puts your account at risk. You don't know how someone else is going to react, and their actions on your account can't be shrugged off as "it wasn't me, my brother did it" when something goes sideways.

While sharing accounts can lead to punishments leading all the way up to a permanent ban based on past history and how serious the offense is, a single act such as this without any prior history wouldn't be anywhere near enough to result in a ban.
he is asking if its bannable .
